Description: Late Roman pilgrim flask; thin lentoid body with a narrow, concave neck; thick, slightly chamfered rim; pair of vertical handles arching from shoulder to just below the rim; coarse orange clay with numerous small white inclusions; crudely incised spiral-motif on one side.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum
Curator's comments: The number 178 pencilled on the front of the vase may refer to the original excavation, though this is unclear. See D. Bailey, Op. Ath. VI (1965), pp. 5-13 for details of the Hake-Kitchener excavations at Kourion. Parallels: Salamis (Diedrichs C. 1980, Salamine de Chypre IX. Céramiques Héllenstiques, Romaines et et Byzantines (Paris), 39-40 nos 131-133 and pls 12-13).
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
